Text.val: This is a selection list program.
1. Task Properties -> General -> Selection table = Yes
2. Use the Locate property to position on a passed code, if any
3. In Record Suffix, pass back the user's choice
For this sample, the data is created on the fly. Usually the data table

Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\cf1\b\f0\fs20 This is an example of a typical \cf2 Selection List \cf1 program. Pressing Enter will force Record Suffix to be executed, and the task will close. \par \par To create this kind of program:\par \par 1. Set Task Properties->\cf2 Selection Table\cf1 to Yes.\par \par 2. Create one parameter, which will be the code sent back to the calling task.\par \par 3. In \cf2 Record Suffix\cf1 , update that parameter to the current value (the one the user selected).\par \par 4. Use the \cf2 Locate From\cf1 property on the Code column to locate on the passed in code, if any.\par }

Text.val: This task writes to a text BLOBS, then reads them into a memory table.
This reads in the blob, using a ':' as a delimiter
